Gordon,
It'd be unusual to have that much empty nanako ground remaining outside the
ends of the design on a Ko-Mino kogai.  They tended to fill the linear space
on kogai more than other groups.  Their kozuka were composed more like most
typical Ko-Kino or Ko-Goto, though.  This one might have been remounted, but
I can't be sure either way from the photos.
Jim
-------------------------

Yeah, not so good pictures, but it has that Ko-Mino look. It also looks
like a Kogai-naoshi.

Gordon
